EXTRACTED VALUE: There's not been a huge gameplay jump snice we last saw NBA Street, but it's certainly wearing far fancier clothes. [Issue 24, p.65]
The additions of the GamerNet and Shot Confidence don't make up for the faulty driving controls and inconsistent putting support.
It is not the sweeping epic we were hoping for but it's still a real delight to play. [Dec 2007, p.74]
In an era where games are getting even-shorter, Blue Dragon is a staggeringly 16-bit, grind-happy title. [Oct 2007, p.53]
The updated graphics and new modes in Bionic Commando Rearmed aren't quite enough to distract from the cumbersome controls.
It is a good game, one that continues to build upon the really great franchise from Namco.
A great first-person shooter, and thrilling almost every step of the way.
The revamped control is an interesting step forward; now all that's missing is a thick layer of polish. [Oct. 2006, p.106]
The best version of soccer that EA has put up to date, and just gets me excited for what lies in store for the full game called FIFA 09 this fall!
It doesn't offer anything innovative, but it's good old-fashioned fun, which is something the Xbox 360 seems to be missing.
For those who love score attack systems and shooting things then membership of The Club is certainly recommended.
Overall, it's a bit of the same old with a few more bells and whistles.
